properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 3 at 8:39AM MST until February 4 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A winter storm will continue to bring snow to portions of
northeastern Wyoming and western South Dakota through this
evening. Heaviest additional snowfall amounts are expected from
southern Campbell County eastward to the Black Hills, then
extending into southwestern South Dakota. Dry air working in from
the north and northeast will limit additional accumulations over
the northern and eastern foothills. Snow will shift southward this
evening before exiting the area tonight.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches.

* WHERE...Oglala Lakota County.

* WHEN...Until midnight MST tonight.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT
